naming_conventions.functions: snake_case verbs, e.g., register_source(), load_pipeline_settings(), write_audit_event()
naming_conventions.r_files: snake_case with role prefix: r/steps/*.R for step logic, r/utilities/*.R for helpers, r/scripts/*.R for user-facing scripts.
naming_conventions.sql_ddls: UPPER_SNAKE object name in filename, e.g., create_SOURCE_REGISTRY.sql, create_AUDIT_LOG.sql.
naming_conventions.schemas: lowercase schema names: governance, raw, staging, validated, reference.
naming_conventions.tables: governance tables are descriptive and singular/plural as already defined: source_registry, audit_log, pipeline_step.

pipeline_conventions.step_wrappers: Each pipeline step has a dedicated wrapper function run_stepX_*() that calls the core step logic and records status via write_pipeline_step().
pipeline_conventions.entrypoints: pulse-launch.R is the user-facing entrypoint; r/scripts/1_onboard_new_source.R is the friendly script that guides humans.
pipeline_conventions.configs: All controlled vocab and global settings live in config/pipeline_settings.yml; per-source settings live in config/source_params.yml.

testing_conventions.unit_tests: Use tests/testthat/*.R with one file per major component: test_step1_register_source.R, test_step1_integration.R.
testing_conventions.helpers: Shared test setup lives in tests/testthat/helper_*.R; helpers source pulse-init-all.R and set proj_root.
testing_conventions.coverage_expectations: Unit tests must cover: invalid vocab, missing fields, folder creation, audit logging, successful registration, and integration with run_pipeline().

governance_principles.auditability: Every source registration event must produce a governance.audit_log entry with timestamps, user, action, and JSON details.
governance_principles.idempotency: register_source() should be safe to run again for the same source_id; it should update rather than duplicate where appropriate.
governance_principles.folder_structure: Folder creation is deterministic and driven by directory_structure.yml; no hard-coded paths.
